1using System;
2using System.Collections.Generic;
3​
4namespace TechnicalIndicators
5{
6 /// <summary>
7 /// Price Volume Trend (PVT)
8 /// </summary>
9 /// <remarks>
10 /// Similar to OBV, but scales volume by percentage price change.
11 /// <list type="bullet">
12 /// <item><description>OBV adds *All* volume if price is up 1 penny.</description></item>
13 /// <item><description>PVT adds *Partial* volume proportional to the % price jump.</description></item>
14 /// <item><description>Formula: PVT = Previous_PVT + (Volume * %Change)</description></item>
15 /// </list>
16 /// </remarks>
17 public class PriceVolumeTrend
18 {
19 public List<decimal?> Values { get; } = new();
20​
21 public void Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
22 {
23 Values.Clear();
24 var candleList = new List<CandleData>(candles);
25 if (candleList.Count == 0) return;
26​
27 decimal pvt = 0;
28 Values.Add(pvt);
29​
30 for (int i = 1; i < candleList.Count; i++)
31 {
32 if (candleList[i - 1].Close == 0)
33 {
34 Values.Add(pvt);
35 continue;
36 }
37​
38 decimal change = (candleList[i].Close - candleList[i - 1].Close) / candleList[i - 1].Close;
39 pvt += change * candleList[i].Volume;
40 Values.Add(pvt);
41 }
42 }
43​
44 public static List<decimal?> Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
45 {
46 var pvt = new PriceVolumeTrend();
47 pvt.Calculate(candles);
48 return pvt.Values;
49 }
50 }
51}

1// =============================================================================
2// PRICE VOLUME TREND (PVT) - Extreme Tutorial Mode
3// =============================================================================
4//
5// [What] Price Volume Trend (PVT) is a cumulative volume indicator that weights
6// volume by the percentage change in price. It measures buying and selling
7// pressure by accumulating volume proportional to price movements.
8//
9// [Why] Traditional OBV treats all volume equally (just +/- the full volume).
10// PVT improves on this by considering HOW MUCH the price changed:
11// - A 5% price move with 1000 volume contributes more than a 0.5% move.
12// - This creates a more accurate picture of money flow.
13//
14// [Visual] Comparison: OBV vs PVT
15//
16// Day 1: Close = 100, Volume = 1000
17// Day 2: Close = 101 (+1%), Volume = 1000
18// Day 3: Close = 110 (+8.9%), Volume = 1000
19//
20// OBV: Day2 = +1000, Day3 = +2000 (both days add full volume)
21// PVT: Day2 = +10, Day3 = +99 (Day3 contributes ~10x more!)
22//
23// +------------------------------------------------------------------+
24// | Price Change Magnitude Matters! |
25// | |
26// | Small Move (1%): Volume × 0.01 = Small PVT contribution |
27// | Large Move (10%): Volume × 0.10 = Large PVT contribution |
28// +------------------------------------------------------------------+
29//
30// [How] Algorithm Overview:
31//
32// ┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
33// │ INITIALIZATION: PVT = 0 (starting point) │
34// ├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
35// │ FOR EACH BAR (starting from bar 1): │
36// │ │
37// │ 1. Calculate price change ratio: │
38// │ change = (Close[i] - Close[i-1]) / Close[i-1] │
39// │ │
40// │ 2. Weight volume by change and accumulate: │
41// │ PVT = PVT + (change × Volume[i]) │
42// │ │
43// └─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
44//
45// [Formula]
46// PVT[0] = 0
47// PVT[i] = PVT[i-1] + ((Close[i] - Close[i-1]) / Close[i-1]) × Volume[i]
48//
49// =============================================================================
50​
51using System;
52using System.Collections.Generic;
53​
54namespace TechnicalIndicators
55{
56 // =========================================================================
57 // [What] CandleData: Immutable record for OHLCV price bar data
58 // =========================================================================
59 public readonly record struct CandleData(
60 DateTime Timestamp,
61 decimal Open,
62 decimal High,
63 decimal Low,
64 decimal Close,
65 long Volume
66 );
67​
68 // =========================================================================
69 // [What] PriceVolumeTrend Class: Volume-weighted cumulative price trend
70 // =========================================================================
71 public class PriceVolumeTrend
72 {
73 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
74 // [What] Values: Stores the calculated PVT for each bar
75 // [Why] List<decimal?> allows null for invalid/missing data points
76 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
77 public List<decimal?> Values { get; } = new();
78​
79 // =====================================================================
80 // [What] Calculate: Main computation method (instance version)
81 // =====================================================================
82 //
83 // [IPO Block]
84 // ┌──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
85 // │ INPUT: candles - Collection of OHLCV price bars │
86 // │ PROCESS: For each bar, calculate % change × volume and cumulate │
87 // │ OUTPUT: Values list populated with PVT for each bar │
88 // └──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
89 //
90 public void Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
91 {
92 // -----------------------------------------------------------------
93 // [What] Clear any previous calculation results
94 // [Why] Ensures fresh calculation when reusing the same instance
95 // -----------------------------------------------------------------
96 Values.Clear();
97​
98 // -----------------------------------------------------------------
99 // [What] Convert to list for indexed access
100 // [Why] We need to look back at previous bar's close price
101 // -----------------------------------------------------------------
102 var candleList = new List<CandleData>(candles);
103 if (candleList.Count == 0) return;
104​
105 // -----------------------------------------------------------------
106 // [What] Initialize PVT accumulator to zero
107 // [Why] PVT is cumulative from a starting point of 0
108 //
109 // [Visual] Data Flow:
110 // Bar 0: PVT = 0 (initial value, no previous bar to compare)
111 // Bar 1+: PVT = PVT + (change × volume)
112 // -----------------------------------------------------------------
113 decimal pvt = 0;
114​
115 // -----------------------------------------------------------------
116 // [What] First bar gets initial PVT = 0
117 // [Why] No previous close to calculate change from
118 // -----------------------------------------------------------------
119 Values.Add(pvt);
120​
121 // -----------------------------------------------------------------
122 // [What] Main loop: Calculate PVT for each subsequent bar
123 //
124 // [Visual] Loop Execution:
125 // ┌────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
126 // │ i=1: Close=101, Prev=100 → change=+0.01 → PVT += 0.01×Vol │
127 // │ i=2: Close=99, Prev=101 → change=-0.02 → PVT -= 0.02×Vol │
128 // │ i=3: Close=105, Prev=99 → change=+0.06 → PVT += 0.06×Vol │
129 // │ ... │
130 // │ ↓ PVT accumulates: up on price rises, down on falls│
131 // └────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
132 // -----------------------------------------------------------------
133 for (int i = 1; i < candleList.Count; i++)
134 {
135 // -------------------------------------------------------------
136 // [What] Check for zero previous close (division by zero guard)
137 // [Why] If previous close is 0, we cannot calculate % change
138 // [How] Keep PVT unchanged and add current value to output
139 // -------------------------------------------------------------
140 if (candleList[i - 1].Close == 0)
141 {
142 Values.Add(pvt);
143 continue;
144 }
145​
146 // -------------------------------------------------------------
147 // [What] Calculate price change as a ratio (percentage/100)
148 //
149 // [Formula] change = (Close[i] - Close[i-1]) / Close[i-1]
150 //
151 // [Example]
152 // Close[i-1] = 100, Close[i] = 105
153 // change = (105 - 100) / 100 = 0.05 (+5%)
154 //
155 // Close[i-1] = 100, Close[i] = 95
156 // change = (95 - 100) / 100 = -0.05 (-5%)
157 // -------------------------------------------------------------
158 decimal change = (candleList[i].Close - candleList[i - 1].Close) / candleList[i - 1].Close;
159​
160 // -------------------------------------------------------------
161 // [What] Accumulate weighted volume into PVT
162 //
163 // [Formula] PVT = PVT + (change × Volume)
164 //
165 // [Visual] Accumulation Logic:
166 // Price Up (+change): PVT increases (buying pressure)
167 // Price Down (-change): PVT decreases (selling pressure)
168 // Price Flat (0): PVT unchanged (no pressure)
169 //
170 // [Example with Volume = 1000]
171 // +5% move: PVT += 0.05 × 1000 = +50
172 // -3% move: PVT += -0.03 × 1000 = -30
173 // -------------------------------------------------------------
174 pvt += change * candleList[i].Volume;
175​
176 // -------------------------------------------------------------
177 // [What] Store the updated PVT value
178 // -------------------------------------------------------------
179 Values.Add(pvt);
180 }
181 }
182​
183 // =====================================================================
184 // [What] Calculate: Static convenience method for one-liner usage
185 // =====================================================================
186 //
187 // [IPO Block]
188 // ┌──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
189 // │ INPUT: candles - Collection of OHLCV price bars │
190 // │ PROCESS: Create instance, calculate, return results │
191 // │ OUTPUT: List of PVT values for each bar │
192 // └──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
193 //
194 // [Usage Example]
195 // var pvtValues = PriceVolumeTrend.Calculate(myCandles);
196 //
197 public static List<decimal?> Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
198 {
199 var pvt = new PriceVolumeTrend();
200 pvt.Calculate(candles);
201 return pvt.Values;
202 }
203 }
204}

1# =============================================================================
2# Logic Breakdown (Price Volume Trend)
3# =============================================================================
4#
5# This document provides a "Deep Dive" into the internal logic of the
6# Price Volume Trend (PVT).
7#
8# [Core Concepts]
9# 1. Proportional Volume Addition
10# - Unlike On Balance Volume (OBV), which adds the *entire* volume if price
11# moves up (regardless of how much), PVT adds a *fraction* of the volume.
12# - The fraction is determined by the percentage change in price.
13# - [Why] A 5% price jump on high volume is more significant than a 0.1% jump
14# on the same volume. PVT captures this "conviction".
15#
16# 2. Cumulative Flow
17# - Like OBV, PVT is a running total.
18# - It confirms trends (PVT rising with Price) or signals divergence.
19#
20# =============================================================================
21​
22# -------------------------------------------------------------
23# Type-Level Explanation: PriceVolumeTrend (class)
24#
25# [Why] Tracks cumulative money flow with magnitude sensitivity.
26# [What] Momentum/Flow indicator.
27# [Who] Institutional traders looking for volume conviction.
28# -------------------------------------------------------------
29class PriceVolumeTrend:
30
31 # -------------------------------------------------------------
32 # Variable Definition: values
33 # [Role] The cumulative PVT series.
34 # [Type] List[float].
35 # -------------------------------------------------------------
36 # values = []
37​
38 # -------------------------------------------------------------
39 # Constructor: __init__
40 # [Why] Initialize storage.
41 # -------------------------------------------------------------
42 def __init__(self):
43 self.values = []
44​
45 # =============================================================================
46 # IPO: calculate
47 # =============================================================================
48 #
49 # [Input]
50 # - candles: List[dict]
51 #
52 # [Process]
53 # 1. Initialize PVT at 0.
54 # 2. Iterate through bars.
55 # 3. Compute Price Change % = (Close - PrevClose) / PrevClose.
56 # 4. Multiply Volume by this %.
57 # 5. Add to running total.
58 #
59 # [Output]
60 # - None (Populates 'values').
61 # =============================================================================
62 def calculate(self, candles):
63
64 # -------------------------------------------------------------
65 # Logic Step 1: Reset
66 #
67 # [Why] Clear previous state.
68 # [How] values.clear().
69 # -------------------------------------------------------------
70 self.values.clear()
71 if len(candles) == 0:
72 return
73​
74 # -------------------------------------------------------------
75 # Logic Step 2: Initialization
76 # [Why] Start accumulation from 0.
77 # [How] Assign 0.0 to accumulator.
78 # -------------------------------------------------------------
79 pvt = 0.0
80 self.values.append(pvt)
81​
82 # -------------------------------------------------------------
83 # Logic Step 3: Main Loop
84 #
85 # [Why] Process each candle to update the cumulative PVT.
86 # [How] Loop from index 1.
87 #
88 # [Visual]
89 # Day 1: Close=100. PVT=0.
90 # Day 2: Close=110 (+10%), Vol=1000.
91 # Add = 0.10 * 1000 = +100.
92 # PVT = 0 + 100 = 100.
93 # Day 3: Close=104.5 (-5%), Vol=2000.
94 # Add = -0.05 * 2000 = -100.
95 # PVT = 100 - 100 = 0.
96 # -------------------------------------------------------------
97 for i in range(1, len(candles)):
98 current_close = candles[i]['close']
99 prev_close = candles[i - 1]['close']
100 volume = candles[i]['volume']
101
102 # [Fail Safe]
103 # Avoid division by zero if stock price is 0 (rare but possible in data errors)
104 if prev_close == 0:
105 self.values.append(pvt)
106 continue
107
108 # -------------------------------------------------------------
109 # Logic Step 3.1: Calculate Percentage Change
110 #
111 # [Why] Determine the magnitude and direction of price movement.
112 # [How] Formula: (Current - Prev) / Prev
113 # -------------------------------------------------------------
114 price_change_percent = (current_close - prev_close) / prev_close
115
116 # -------------------------------------------------------------
117 # Logic Step 3.2: Scale Volume
118 # [Why] We only count the portion of volume "responsible" for the move.
119 # [How] Multiplication: Volume * %Change.
120 # -------------------------------------------------------------
121 volume_contribution = price_change_percent * volume
122
123 # -------------------------------------------------------------
124 # Logic Step 3.3: Accumulate
125 #
126 # [Why] Update the running total (Cumulative Line).
127 # [How] += operator.
128 # -------------------------------------------------------------
129 pvt += volume_contribution
130
131 self.values.append(pvt)
132​
133# =============================================================================
134# Static Wrapper Function
135# =============================================================================
136#
137# [Why] Functional API.
138# [Usage] pvt_values = calculate(candles)
139# =============================================================================
140def calculate(candles):
141 instance = PriceVolumeTrend()
142 instance.calculate(candles)
143 return instance.values
